text: Gather sharp thorns under the moon's gaze.
Carve cryptic marks onto forgotten wood.
Place a cracked mirror where shadows linger.
Ignite small fires with fragments of old regrets.
Blend rainwater with bitter herbs, let it sit.
Tie knots in threads as you recount your fears.
Bury metal under the ground, wait for rust.
Weave your hair into a cloth of uncertain purpose.
Sew shadows into the seams of your clothes.
Collect whispers from hollow trees, carry them.
Stitch together scraps of paper with regrets.
Chant as you scatter shattered glass in the wind.
Carve symbols into your skin, let them fade.
Wrap fallen leaves in blackened cloth, hide them.
Place cracked stones beneath your pillow, dream.
Tie bones together with dried tendrils, hang them.
Burn old letters, breathe the smoke, exhale despair.
Paint symbols with blood on the stones you find.
Collect stagnant water in jars, set them aside.
Plant seeds in soil mixed with your own doubt.
Stare into darkness until your eyes water.
Wrap your hands in thorns, feel the sting.
Chisel cracks into your reflection, shatter it.
Let ink run in rainwater, watch words blur.
Collect fragments of shattered mirrors, keep them close.
Strike flint against bone, watch sparks die.
Sew your lips shut with threads of whispered doubts.
Carve your wishes into the roots of gnarled trees.
Mix tears with soil, let them soak, let them rot.
Tangle your fingers in the webs of waiting spiders.
Gather crows' feathers, tie them to your wrists.
Mingle your heartbeat with a dry night wind.
Burn dried herbs, breathe the acrid smoke.
Dig your fingers into the earth, feel decay.
Whisper your fears into the cracks of decaying wood.
Tread barefoot on shards of broken glass, don't flinch.
Breathe curses into small jars, seal them tight.
Pour stagnant water over your hands, let it cling.
Ink your palms with your darkest thoughts.
Wrap your ankles with thorns, let them draw blood.
Carve your doubts into stone, let them stand.
Strike a match and watch it burn, feel its heat.
Sew together strands of hair, let them unravel.
Plant seeds in darkness, let them struggle to grow.
Carve your regrets into your skin, let them scar.
Chant as you toss salt into the wind, let it scatter.
Let ink bleed on paper, watch the words blur.
Bind your fears in cloth, bury them deep.
Whisper secrets to the empty night, let them fade.
Stare into the abyss; give form to the fears you find there; pin them with the rest.
